title: Introduction to 'ggtibble'
text: time time, list ggplots able work like regular ggplot can helpful. example, writing report, may want make set figures separate various levels group, make separate figures group.

title: Introduction to 'ggtibble'
text: ggtibble package two main functions create sets figures, ggtibble() gglist(). create tibble optional labels per figure captions (ggtibble()) simpler list figures (gglist()). ggtibble gglist objects can ggplot geoms, facets, labels, lists added though normal ggplot objects. , can add gglist either ggtibble gglist.

title: Introduction to 'ggtibble'
text: Typical use load required libraries, setup plot data, generate plot, knit_print() . generating plot: Give dataset, Indicate columns plotting using aes() mapping ggplot2 object, Provide outercols columns outside dataset; one plot generated unique level data outercols. Note use outercols columns within plot, use captions labels. can give caption glue::glue_data() specification valid columns column names outercols specification. (don’t give caption, empty string, "".) can give list labels processed caption via glue::glue_data() passed labs(). plot setup ways specific ggtibble, use like normal ggplot object adding geoms, etc. Horsepower displacement 6 cars Horsepower displacement 4 cars Horsepower displacement 8 cars
code: # Note, add `fig.cap=all_plots$caption` to show the generated caption for the # figures  library(ggtibble) library(dplyr) #>  #> Attaching package: 'dplyr' #> The following objects are masked from 'package:stats': #>  #>     filter, lag #> The following objects are masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     intersect, setdiff, setequal, union library(ggplot2)  d_plot <-   mtcars |>   mutate(     dispu = "cu. in."   ) all_plots <-   ggtibble(     d_plot,     aes(x = disp, y = hp),     outercols = c("cyl", "dispu"),     caption = "Horsepower by displacement for {cyl} cars",     labs = list(x = "Displacement ({dispu})", y = "Gross horsepower")   ) +   geom_point() +   geom_line()  # The result is a tibble with columns for the `data_plot`, `figure`, and # `caption` as_tibble(all_plots) #> # A tibble: 3 × 5 #>     cyl dispu   data_plot                   figure caption                       #>   <dbl> <chr>   <list>                    <gglist> <glue>                        #> 1     6 cu. in. <tibble [7 × 10]>  A ggplot object Horsepower by displacement f… #> 2     4 cu. in. <tibble [11 × 10]> A ggplot object Horsepower by displacement f… #> 3     8 cu. in. <tibble [14 × 10]> A ggplot object Horsepower by displacement f…  # You can then show all the figures with the `knit_print()` method. knit_print(all_plots)

title: Authors and Citation
text: Bill Denney. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Denney B (2024). ggtibble: Create Tibbles Lists 'ggplot' Figures Reporting. R package version 1.0.0, https://billdenney.github.io/ggtibble/.
code: @Manual{,   title = {ggtibble: Create Tibbles and Lists of 'ggplot' Figures for Reporting},   author = {Bill Denney},   year = {2024},   note = {R package version 1.0.0},   url = {https://billdenney.github.io/ggtibble/}, }

what: Create Tibbles and Lists of ggplot Figures for Reporting
title: Create Tibbles and Lists of ggplot Figures for Reporting
text: goal ggtibble allow creation similarly-formatted figures lists ggplots (gglist) tibbles lists captions. augmented knit_print() methods enabling simple inclusion reports.

title: Create Tibbles and Lists of ggplot Figures for Reporting
text: can install development version ggtibble GitHub :

title: Create Tibbles and Lists of ggplot Figures for Reporting
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(ggtibble) d_plot <-   data.frame(     A = rep(c("foo", "bar"), each = 4),     B = 1:8,     C = 11:18,     Bunit = "mg",     Cunit = "km"   ) all_plots <-   ggtibble(     d_plot,     ggplot2::aes(x = B, y = C),     outercols = c("A", "Bunit", "Cunit"),     caption = "All the {A}",     labs = list(x = "B ({Bunit})", y = "C ({Cunit})")   ) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggplot2::geom_line() knit_print(all_plots)

what: Generate a list of ggplots from a list of data.frames — gglist
title: Generate a list of ggplots from a list of data.frames — gglist
text: Generate list ggplots list data.frames

title: Generate a list of ggplots from a list of data.frames — gglist
code: gglist(   data = NULL,   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   ...,   environment = parent.frame() )

title: Generate a list of ggplots from a list of data.frames — gglist
text: data list data.frames (similar objects) mapping Default list aesthetic mappings use plot. specified, must supplied layer added plot. ... arguments passed methods. currently used. environment Used prior tidy evaluation.

title: Generate a list of ggplots from a list of data.frames — gglist
text: list ggplot2 objects

title: Generate a list of ggplots from a list of data.frames — gglist
code: mydata <-   list(     data.frame(x = 1:3, y = 3:1),     data.frame(x = 4:7, y = 7:4)   ) gglist(mydata, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +   ggplot2::geom_point()

what:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
title:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
text: Make tibble one column data plot, one gglist, one caption

title:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
code: ggtibble(data, ...)  # S3 method for data.frame ggtibble(   data,   mapping = ggplot2::aes(),   ...,   outercols = group_vars(data),   labs = list(),   caption = "" )

title:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
text: data data.frame plot ... Passed subsequent methods (usually passed gglist()) mapping Default list aesthetic mappings use plot. specified, must supplied layer added plot. outercols columns outside nesting labs Labels add via labs_glue() caption glue specification creating caption

title:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
text: data.frame column named "data_plot" data plot, "figure" gglist, "caption" captions ggtibble object tibble columns named "figure" gglist object (list ggplots), "data_plot" list data.frames making source data used individual plot, "caption" text use plot caption, outercols used nesting.

title:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
text: ggtibble(data.frame): default method data.frame tibble

title:
Make a tibble where one column is the data to plot, one is the gglist, and
one is the caption — ggtibble
code: d_plot <-   data.frame(     A = rep(c("foo", "bar"), each = 4),     B = 1:8,     C = 11:18,     Bunit = "mg",     Cunit = "km"   ) all_plots <-   ggtibble(     d_plot,     ggplot2::aes(x = B, y = C),     outercols = c("A", "Bunit", "Cunit"),     caption = "All the {A}",     labs = list(x = "B ({Bunit})", y = "C ({Cunit})")   ) +   ggplot2::geom_point() +   ggplot2::geom_line() knit_print(all_plots) #>  #>   #>  #>  #>  #>  #>  #>   #>  #>  #>  #>

what: Print a ggplot (usually within knit_print.gglist) — knit_print.gg
title: Print a ggplot (usually within knit_print.gglist) — knit_print.gg
text: Print ggplot (usually within knit_print.gglist)

title: Print a ggplot (usually within knit_print.gglist) — knit_print.gg
code: # S3 method for gg knit_print(   x,   ...,   fig_prefix,   fig_suffix,   filename = NULL,   width = 6,   height = 4,   units = "in" )

title: Print a ggplot (usually within knit_print.gglist) — knit_print.gg
text: x gg object (.e. ggplot) ... Ignored fig_prefix Text cat() figure printed fig_suffix text add figure filename filename saving plot width, height, units Plot size units ("", "cm", "mm", "px"). supplied, uses size current graphics device.

title: Print a ggplot (usually within knit_print.gglist) — knit_print.gg
text: gg object, invisibly

what: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
title: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
text: filename argument may given sprintf() format including "%d" allow automatic numbering output filenames.  Specifically, pattern "%d" optional non-negative integer "%" "d" searched found, filename generated using sprintf() format.  Note also means requirements sprintf() must met; example, want percent sign ("%") filename, must doubled sprintf returns desired.

title: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
code: # S3 method for gglist knit_print(x, ..., filename = NULL, fig_suffix = "\n\n")  # S3 method for ggtibble knit_print(x, ...)

title: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
text: x gglist object ... extra arguments knit_print() filename filename optional "%d" sprintf pattern saving plots fig_suffix text add figure

title: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
text: list, invisibly

title: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
text: knit_print(ggtibble): Print plots ggtibble object

title: Print a list of plots made by gglist — knit_print.gglist
code:
# Ensure that each figure is within its own float area mydata <-   list(     data.frame(x = 1:3, y = 3:1),     data.frame(x = 4:7, y = 7:4)   ) p <- gglist(mydata, ggplot2::aes(x = x, y = y)) +   ggplot2::geom_point() knit_print(p, fig_suffix = "

\FloatBarrier

") #>  #>   #>  #>  #> \FloatBarrier #>  #>  #>  #>  #>   #>  #>  #> \FloatBarrier #>  #>  #>
